main event: A light, no brighter than a star, was observed pulsating and changing colors over Pleasant Garden, North Carolina on August 30, 1953.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 12 minutes, The object moved off to the north without performing any maneuvers, The observer reported atmospheric conditions affecting visibility, The witness estimated the object to be about the size of a helicopter, The report contains sketches of the object and its trajectory.
sighted object: a pulsating light in the sky
witness description: a 62-year-old male, former Air Force radar technician
